intro: Symplocos condorensis, commonly known as the Peruvian beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by bright blue berries that are edible for some bird species. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. The leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
